author: admin
title: Swiss Re, Softbank call off talks on potential investment
text:
Home / Insurance News Articles Updates / Swiss Re, Softbank call off talks on potential investment Swiss Re, Softbank call off talks on potential investment
Christian Hartmann | Reuters
The Swiss Re building in Zurich is shown in this Feb. 19, 2009 photo.
Insurance company Swiss Re and Softbank have agreed to end discussions about a potential minority investment by the Japanese technology conglomerate.
Swiss Re didn’t give reasons for the move in a brief statement Monday. The companies had announced in February that they were in preliminary discussions.
Zurich-based Swiss Re is one of the world’s biggest reinsurers, which provide backup policies to companies that write primary insurance policies.
The company said it will “further explore business ideas between Swiss Re’s operative entities and the portfolio companies of Softbank.”
